title: PastyKyle
author: PastyKyle
created_time: November 16, 2022, 05:36:42 AMLast edit: November 16, 2022, 06:04:17 AM by PastyKyle
content: I can get you a crypto casino sponsorship, I have a lot of contacts from these crypto casinos, and I can get you your custom deal, You're going to have to produce content of course on Twitch.tv/Dlive.tv/Youtube.com/Tiktok or other streaming platforms. Crypto casinos tend to pay the most when it comes to sponsorships, TrainWrecksTV one of the biggest twitch streamers revealed that he got paid over 360,000,000$ from Stake.com, So It's definitely worth giving it a shot, I'll setup everything for you, Channel and everything. I charge for these services so If you're interested in this service please add my discord to discuss prices and more! I'll also provide you with a list with all the people I worked with. Been doing this for over 3 years now, Helped well over 100 streamers.Discord: Kyle#9581

comments.author: yahoo62278
comments.body: I would consider listing which casinos you might be able to get users deals on and possibly the type of deal they might be able to get. People may not be interested in certain casinos like say Rocketpot or 1xbit. I have the ability to do this myself for a certain casino and the deal depends on your # of followers and average viewers. The bigger casinos don't really care about small numbers of average viewers, but someone like 500 casino might.

comments.author: janggernaut
comments.body: Kyle, i remember that name from other gambling site, used to be active but now the site is almost have no any people to gamble again. But kyle, since you have helped over 100 streamers, why do you still looking for new people? Didn't you have get enough money from those 100 people? Let say 1 person gave you $10,000 as thank you, you already have $1,000,000 now.But i agree with @yahoo, most of sites or even a small site, only interested with people who have bunch of followers/subscribers, how you will convince them to hire new people who just started?

comments.author: Daltonik
comments.body: Indeed, the largest casinos do not require mediation to conclude sponsorship agreements, and the popular streamers themselves have the opportunity to choose from the offers they receive. I don't think that here on the forum, I can be wrong, there are so really popular media people demanding promotion.

comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: Quote from: PastyKyle on November 16, 2022, 05:36:42 AMTrainWrecksTV one of the biggest twitch streamers revealed that he got paid over 360,000,000$ from Stake.com,    This is one hell of a cash there, but this is hard to believe, not without a prove, but anyways, back to your offer..I am interested but i am skeptical, i tell you why, for someone of your caliber, that is you have this casino contact and know that they pay this much, and for somebody ,you have all it takes to set up accounts and provide all the materials required for that person to start streaming for one or some of this casinos, why arent you yourself busy yet, i mean dont you like to be super rich ? why settle for less when you have the means to become a multi millionaire streaming for this casinos?I honestly do not believe you, maybe you can try to show us some persons, out of the over hundred persons you said youve helped secure this deal.then and only, will i think about having a discussion with you on this subject.

comments.author: yahoo62278
comments.body: Quote from: Fivestar4everMVP on November 16, 2022, 04:55:21 PMQuote from: PastyKyle on November 16, 2022, 05:36:42 AMTrainWrecksTV one of the biggest twitch streamers revealed that he got paid over 360,000,000$ from Stake.com,    This is one hell of a cash there, but this is hard to believe, not without a prove, but anyways, back to your offer..I am interested but i am skeptical, i tell you why, for someone of your caliber, that is you have this casino contact and know that they pay this much, and for somebody ,you have all it takes to set up accounts and provide all the materials required for that person to start streaming for one or some of this casinos, why arent you yourself busy yet, i mean dont you like to be super rich ? why settle for less when you have the means to become a multi millionaire streaming for this casinos?I honestly do not believe you, maybe you can try to show us some persons, out of the over hundred persons you said youve helped secure this deal.then and only, will i think about having a discussion with you on this subject. I don't think train profitted 360m during his time with Stake, but he did have a massive deal. The thing is, he got that deal because of his community. Same goes for all streamers who might be interested in something like this. If you have a community with potential customers for the casino, they might be willing to talk with you and offer something. Everyone who gets a deal gets different offers as well and again all is dependent of your community. If you are a new streamer with 5 followers and average 2 viewers per stream, you have 0 chance at getting a deal. I'm not trying to hijack your thread or anything, I'm trying to advise you on how to get more interest rather then you get 500 message requests on discord that 99.9% will be people with no community and wasting your time. Give a few details on minimum viewers needed and followers for a better result.

comments.body: I would probably tell everyone to steer clear of this. I asked the user to delete this post and I would leave it at that(obviously I'm letting my contacts know as well), but he seems to be not interested in doing so.Basically, he's scamming the casinos.

comments.author: UserU
comments.body: Quote from: yahoo62278 on November 17, 2022, 01:42:00 AMI would probably tell everyone to steer clear of this. I asked the user to delete this post and I would leave it at that(obviously I'm letting my contacts know as well), but he seems to be not interested in doing so.Thanks for taking one for the team. At 500 Casino, we accept both smaller and big time streamers through the Content Creator program so there's no need to fake the stats, although applicants still have to undergo the standard vetting process. What matters most is that the streamers maintain their professional behavior while helping to promote the brand through organic means.

comments.author: TwitchySeal
comments.created_time: November 27, 2022, 02:48:57 PMLast edit: November 27, 2022, 03:01:42 PM by TwitchySeal
comments.body: Quote from: yahoo62278 on November 16, 2022, 10:28:12 PMQuote from: Fivestar4everMVP on November 16, 2022, 04:55:21 PMQuote from: PastyKyle on November 16, 2022, 05:36:42 AMTrainWrecksTV one of the biggest twitch streamers revealed that he got paid over 360,000,000$ from Stake.com,    This is one hell of a cash there, but this is hard to believe, not without a prove, but anyways, back to your offer..I am interested but i am skeptical, i tell you why, for someone of your caliber, that is you have this casino contact and know that they pay this much, and for somebody ,you have all it takes to set up accounts and provide all the materials required for that person to start streaming for one or some of this casinos, why arent you yourself busy yet, i mean dont you like to be super rich ? why settle for less when you have the means to become a multi millionaire streaming for this casinos?I honestly do not believe you, maybe you can try to show us some persons, out of the over hundred persons you said youve helped secure this deal.then and only, will i think about having a discussion with you on this subject. I don't think train profitted 360m during his time with Stake, but he did have a massive deal. The thing is, he got that deal because of his community. I wouldn't be surprised if train were down even after the 360 million.  Pretty sure he's wagered 5+ billion playing mostly third party slots with 5-7% house edge... that's $50 - $70 million in expected losses per billion (before rakeback, bonuses, etc to be fair), but it seems like he's run pretty bad overall.  What is he doing now after the twitch gambling ban?

comments.author: yahoo62278
comments.body: Quote from: TwitchySeal on November 27, 2022, 02:48:57 PMQuote from: yahoo62278 on November 16, 2022, 10:28:12 PMQuote from: Fivestar4everMVP on November 16, 2022, 04:55:21 PMQuote from: PastyKyle on November 16, 2022, 05:36:42 AMTrainWrecksTV one of the biggest twitch streamers revealed that he got paid over 360,000,000$ from Stake.com,    This is one hell of a cash there, but this is hard to believe, not without a prove, but anyways, back to your offer..I am interested but i am skeptical, i tell you why, for someone of your caliber, that is you have this casino contact and know that they pay this much, and for somebody ,you have all it takes to set up accounts and provide all the materials required for that person to start streaming for one or some of this casinos, why arent you yourself busy yet, i mean dont you like to be super rich ? why settle for less when you have the means to become a multi millionaire streaming for this casinos?I honestly do not believe you, maybe you can try to show us some persons, out of the over hundred persons you said youve helped secure this deal.then and only, will i think about having a discussion with you on this subject. I don't think train profitted 360m during his time with Stake, but he did have a massive deal. The thing is, he got that deal because of his community. I wouldn't be surprised if train were down even after the 360 million.  Pretty sure he's wagered 5+ billion playing mostly third party slots with 5-7% house edge... that's $50 - $70 million in expected losses per billion (before rakeback, bonuses, etc to be fair), but it seems like he's run pretty bad overall.  What is he doing now after the twitch gambling ban?  Surprisingly enough, Twitch has only banned the few sites that were mentioned in their email. Stake, Roobet, and a couple others. Other then that, streamers have still been streaming for Gamdom on the platform. As far as Train goes, Eddie mentioned that Train will start streaming again sometime this weekend. He will likely be using the Kick platform for streams now.
